tool.name: PublishRoutingServices

param.name: network_dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify a layer from the table of contents in ArcMap that references the network dataset used to perform analysis. If the network dataset is licensed, for example, it is part of StreetMap Premium for ArcGIS, a valid license for accessing the network dataset should be installed before running the tool.

param.name: service_definition_folder
param.dialogReference: Specify the folder to store the service definition files for the routing services.

param.name: server_data_folder_path
param.dialogReference: Specify the full path to the folder containing the network dataset on the ArcGIS Server site. This folder must already exist on all the machines that participate in the ArcGIS Server site and should include the network dataset used by the routing services. A valid license, if required to access the network dataset, should be installed on each machine.

param.name: server_url
param.dialogReference:
Specify the URL for the ArcGIS Server site. The URL should allow administrative access to the ArcGIS Server site. It is usually of the form https://machine.domain.com:6443/arcgis

If you use https in the server url, you need to ensure that your GIS server is using a valid SSL certificate or your GIS Server's SSL certificate is installed as a trusted certificate by importing the certificate into the OS certificate store on the machine running Publish Routing Services tool.

param.name: user_name
param.dialogReference: Specify the user name for a user with adminstrator privilege for managing the ArcGIS Server site. If the GIS Server is federated with Portal for ArcGIS, the user name parameter is not required as the credentials for the user signed in to ArcGIS for Desktop is used.

param.name: password
param.dialogReference: Specify the password for a user with adminstrator privilege for managing the ArcGIS Server site. If the GIS Server is federated with Portal for ArcGIS, the password parameter is not required as the credentials for the user signed in to ArcGIS for Desktop is used.

tool.summary: The tool publishes routing services to an ArcGIS Server site. The services can be used to perform route, closest facility, service area, location-allocation and vehicle routing problem analyses on a transportation network in synchronous and asynchronous execution modes. After running the tool, the routing services can be configured with Portal for ArcGIS as route and network utility services that can be used by applications such as the directions button or the analysis tools in map viewer or with ArcGIS Pro.
tool.usage:
• The tool requires a Network Analyst Extension license.

  • The tool should be run only from within ArcMap and not as a stand-alone python script as it requires a network dataset layer that references the network dataset.

  • The tool does not copy the network dataset to the ArcGIS Server site. The data should already exist on all machines that are participating in ArcGIS Server site.

  • If your are publishing services to a GIS Server that is federated with Portal for ArcGIS, you must be signed in to the portal from ArcMap with a user that has administrator privleges for managing the portal. You can use ArcGIS Administrator application to manage portal connections.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: The tool publishes routing services to an ArcGIS Server site. The services can be used to perform route, closest facility, service area, location-allocation and vehicle routing problem analyses on a transportation network in synchronous and asynchronous execution modes. After running the tool, the routing services can be configured with Portal for ArcGIS as route and network utility services that can be used by applications such as the directions button or the analysis tools in map viewer or with ArcGIS Pro.
